organic_results.title: The role of gender in college classroom interactions: A social context approach
organic_results.snippet: This study examined the social construction of gender differences in classroom interactions during the first five years of a former women's college's transition to mixed-sex education. The classroom interaction patterns of male and female professors and students were considerably altered by the transition and by the gender composition of the classes. For example, male and female professors initiated comparable numbers of interactions in the all-female classrooms, but female professors initiated many more interactions and male …
